channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #197 - YAPC::EU Master classes - talks - hackathons
item.description:
Hi,

YAPC::EU is still 4 month away, but you can already register enjoying the early-bird discount. The call for master classes, hackathons and talks is still open.

In the meantime the German Perl Workshop is just around the corner.

May the 4th be with you!
item.dc:subject: list of tags?

item.title: Perl Jobs on the Perl Maven site
item.description: Are you looking for a Perl job? Find it listed on the Perl Maven site.

item.title: German Perlworkshop 2015 - this week
item.description: May 6th - 8th, 2015 in Dresden, Germany. Please note, there is a strike by the train drivers of the Deutsche Bahn. Plan your journey accordingly!

item.title: YAPC::EU Master classes - talks - hackathons
item.description: There are currently 2 master classes, but if you'd like to run your own training class, you can still propose one. Same with Hackathons. There are 34 accepted talks so far. More are needed.

item.title: Three Tales of Second System Syndrome
item.description: Comparing the release of Python 3, the lack of release of PHP 6, and the imminent release of Perl 6.

item.title: More QA Hackathon reports
item.description: Although Neil has sent a collection of reports last week, more reports have arrived: Philippe Bruhat (BooK) the French Perl Monger who wrote Act; Olaf Alders from MetaCPAN.

item.title: Explaining the Schwartzian Transform
item.description: Code with some comments.

item.title: Perl Catalyst 5.90090 Has Landed
item.description: Solid backwards compatibility and the biggest new features is Arg and CaptureArg type constraints.

item.title: Increasing the likelihood of a PR merge
item.description: The CPAN PR Challenge of Neil has been working quite well and helped Neil to refine his advice on what would constitute a good Pull Request. He points out that if the change is really useful that will make it much more likely to grab the attention of the author and he gives a number of 'best practices' on communicating with the author and making it easier for her/him to integrate the changes.

item.title: Plotting the CPAN river - a first dabble
item.description: Last week Neil proposed describing CPAN and the interdependencies as a flowing from its root, perl itself to the ocean of ... This week he started to draw the river.

item.title: Curating old releases on CPAN
item.description: What to do with distributions last released in 1995? Should they be removed from CPAN? Updated? Left alone?

item.title: My March & April CPAN PR Challenge dists
item.description: Garu has patched Web::Library::UnderscoreJS and Mojolicious::Plugin::ServerStatus. Interesting modules.

item.title: my dumb CPAN "meta analyzer"
item.description: Traversing CPAN and extracting stuff.

item.title: Abandoning all Perl modules
item.description: Caleb has stopped using Perl. You can take over modules from him. See more info.

item.title: Maintaining the Perl 5 Core: Report, Months 17, & 18
item.description: Dave spent the month mainly fixing issues reported by the Coverity static code analyser, and fixing assorted bugs that were in the main 5.22 blockers.

item.title: Call For Grant Proposals (May 2015 Round)
item.description: Dead-line for the TPF grant proposals is 15th May.

item.title: This week: the big NFG switch on, and many fixes
item.description: Rakudo on MoarVM uses NFG (Normal Form Grapheme) now

item.title: Parsing Perl 5 pod with Perl 6
item.description: A good exercise in using Perl 6

item.title: A general profile photo that looks in the camera
item.description: Flavio reminds us all that when you put a picture of a person on a slide (or a blog post, or an e-mail), make sure the person does not look away from the text. Either the person on the side should look at the text, s/he should straight ahead. The latter will indicate that the person on the page is interested in the reader.

item.title: Dada Mail Eight Released
item.description: Dada Mail is an Open Source Contemporary Mailing List Manager written in Perl. This release moved from CGI to FastCGI and Plack/PSGI.

item.title: Microsoft's Visual Studio Code editor
item.description: ...ships with the Perl 6 syntax highlighting.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Getting started with MongoDB using Perl - insert and simple update
Start using Template Toolkit to show the empty pages
item.description: Part of the search.cpan.org cloning project.

item.title: Echo server with logging and timeout
item.description: Part of the Net::Server series.

item.title: Writing Command line scripts and accepting command line parameters using Moo
item.description: MooX::Options is an integration of Moo, the minimal OOP framework for Perl and the Getopt::Long, the standard command line processing module. Reddit
